media.caption: Machine Learning Visual Graph from Wordstream.

text.headline:
History of Machine Learning in a Specific Era
1950s - 2020s
text.text: A Short History of Machine Learning from Beginning to the 21st Century.

text.headline: The Famous “Turing Test”
text.text: Alan Turing created the essay titled “Computing Machinery and Intelligence”, this introduced the Turing Test to ask “Can machines think?”. The purpose was to test the intelligence of machines, this is carried out to see if a machine’s behavior is indistinguishable from a human’s in a text-based conversation.

media.caption: SNARC Machine
media.credit: Medium Article: click to go to source

text.headline: Marvin Minsky's “SNARC”
text.text: Stochastic Neural Analog Reinforcement Calculator (SNARC) is an early neural network simulation machine designed by Marvin Minsky. It was one of the first attempts in mimicking how the human brain learn, with the use of a network of 40 simulated neurons connected with randomly changing strengths. It is considered one of the first pioneering attempts at the field of Artificial Intelligence.

media.caption: “The Father of Machine Learning”, Arthur Samuel playing checkers.

text.headline: Samuel Checkers
text.text: This is considered one of the world’s first successful machine learning program. It improved by playing against itself until the mid-1970s, where the program achieved sufficient skill to challenge an amateur. Arthur Samuel’s work introduced the concept of Machine Learning.

media.caption: List of Attendees at the Conference.

text.headline: Artificial Intelligence
text.text: John McCarthy organizes the Dartmouth Conference where the term was coined. The researchers believe that machines are capable of thinking and learning like humans.

media.caption: Frank Rosenblatt working on the “electronic profile analyzing computer” – a precursor to the perceptron.

text.headline: Rosenblatt’s Perceptron
text.text: The “Perceptron” is a precursor to artificial neural networks pattern recognition. Researcher were thrilled with the idea that computers could learn basic tasks. However, its drawbacks would cause AI to face early failures.

text.headline: “ELIZA” the Chatbot
text.text: Joseph Weizenbaum creates “ELIZA”, a program that simulates a conversation with a psychotherapist. It worked by pattern-matching user input and responding with scripted lines.

media.caption: Timeline of the AI winters.
media.credit: Research Gate: click to go to source

text.headline: AI Winter
text.text: AI Winter is a period of reduced research interest and funding in AI. Progress slowed as AI programs failed to meet high expectations and many consider AI as an overhyped idea at this point.

media.caption: How Expert Systems Work
media.credit: Jaro Education: :click to go to source

text.headline: “Expert” Systems
text.text: AI returned to popularity with Expert Systems, programs that stored human expert knowledge aimed to solve problems. They were used in industries like medicine and business for decision-making.

media.caption: Visual of Backpropagation
media.credit: Geeks For Geeks: click to go to source

text.headline: Backpropagation
text.text: Geoffrey Hinton and others popularized the backpropagation algorithm, which made it possible to train multi-layer neural networks. It set the stage for modern deep learning.

media.caption: Chess champion “Garry Kasparov” playing against Deep Blue

text.headline: Deep Blue
text.text: Deep Blue is a Chess Playing Computer made by IBM. IBM’s Deep Blue defeated world chess champion Garry Kasparov in 1996.

text.headline: "The Bodyguard"
text.text: Houston starred opposite Kevin Costner in the box office hit, The Bodyguard. The soundtrack to the movie sold over 44 million copies worldwide  garnering 3 Grammy's for the artist.

media.caption: Bobby Brown performing "My Prerogrative," from his "Don't be Cruel" solo album. Bobby Brown first became famous with the R&B group, New Edition.

text.headline: Married Life
text.text:
After three years of courtship, Houston marries New Edition singer Bobby Brown. Their only child Bobbi Kristina Brown was born in 1993.

In 2003 Brown was charged with domestic violence after police responded to a domestic violence call. Houston and Brown were featured in the reality show, "Being bobby Brown," and divorced in 2007.

text.headline: Crack is Whack
text.text: Houston first publicly admitted to drug use in an interview with Diane Sawyer. The singer coined the term "Crack is Whack," saying that she only used more expensive drugs.

media.caption: Addiction expert, Dr. Drew, talks about Whitney's death and her struggle with addiction.

text.headline: Rehab
text.text: Houston entered rehab several times beginning in 2004. She declared herself drug free in an interview with Oprah Winfrey in 2009 but returned to rehab in 2011.

text.headline: Being Bobby Brown
text.text: Being Bobby Brown was a reality show starring Brown and wife Whitney Houston. Houston refused to sign for a second season. A clip of her telling Brown to "Kiss my ass," became a running gag on The Soup.

text.headline: A Rocky Comeback
text.text: Houston's comeback tour is cut short due to a diminished voice damaged by years of smoking. She was reportedly devastated at her inability to perform like her old self.

media.caption: Houston, performing on Good Morning America in 2009.

text.headline:
Whitney Houston
1963-2012
text.text: Houston, 48, was discovered dead at the Beverly Hilton Hotel on on Feb. 11, 2012. She is survived by her daughter, Bobbi Kristina Brown, and mother, Cissy Houston.
